chargeHist.descr: Deliver Heroin within 1000 feet of a park as repeater (<3g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J. NELESEN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Deliver Schedule II Narcotics within 1000 feet of a park as repeater (Roxicodone)

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain full-time employment/schooling combination.
Obtain HSED or equivalent.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No association with known drug users or dealers.

No presence in any bars or liquor stores.

Provide DNA sample.

The State moves to dismiss and read in count 1.  Motion granted.
The court orders a Presentence Investigation Report.
PSI due on 09-23-15.
Sentencing is set for 10-01-15 at 10:30 a.m.
Bail is continued.
The Court orders a DNA sample at this time.
